title: Update actix, quick-xml and other dependencies to avoid warnings about future Rust incompatibilties
Fix importing corpora with linked files
body: When the path to the imported file is relative to the current working directory the import could fail.

title: Fix issue when re-using an ID in the symbol table
Add GitHub action to report code coverage on a PR
body:
This uses the barcheck.com GitHub application for now, but it should be possible to adapt it to other providers.

Code coverage is measured using the helper script and compared to a baseline on main.

title: Fix relANNIS corpus import PartOf connection to parent corpus
Allow to configure how spans should be interpreted in the view when the token layer is representing a timeline
Fixed wrong result order for non-token searches.
Subgraph generation without query
body:
Faster subgraph generation for subgraph queries with context. 

The previous implementation used an AQL query that got quite complex over time and was difficult to execute. The new implemenation directly implements the logic using iterators. It also sorts the nodes in the iterator by the order of the node in the text.

title: Add lexer feature to avoid compilation issues with 2021 edition of Rust.
body: See https://github.com/lalrpop/lalrpop/issues/650

title: Improve count estimation for (negated) regular expressions
Use disk based sorting for ordering the matches
body:
For huge query results, sorting the results in memory can fail because there is not enough RAM.
We should default to sort the results on disk. For small results (that fits into memory) the difference is not large in absolute values and for huge results handling them only becomes feasible by this approach.

title: Use major version as documentation folder name instead of major.minor
Fix left/right context for queries with segmentation

title: Bump sys-info from 0.5.6 to 0.9.1 in /examples/tutorial

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [sys-info](https://github.com/FillZpp/sys-info-rs) from 0.5.6 to 0.9.1.
Changelog

Sourced from sys-info's changelog.

0.9.1

  • Fix iOS Support and CPU speed doesn't work on ARM64 Macs either.
  • Rust Nightly fix
  • Add a cast to allow building on ILP32 systems
  • Prevent free swap from getting larger than total swap
  • Fix compiler errors/warnings for NetBSD/arm

0.9.0

  • Typo fixes & test fixup
  • macOS: On failure copy the unknown value and null-terminate it correctly
  • Fix windows-gnu build
  • Support for NetBSD platform

0.8.0

  • Fix build for target android
  • add OpenBSD support
  • Make get_cpu_speed arch-independent on windows
  • improve get_mem_info on macos
  • Make Disk Info Thread-Safe on Linux
  • Loop to find max CPU speed in Windows get_cpu_speed

0.7.0

  • FreeBSD port.

0.6.1

  • Restore Send trait to Error for wrapping with error-chain
  • Use cfg attribute instead of cfg! macro, which fixes Windows build errors in v0.6.0

0.6.0

  • Support illumos and Solaris systems

0.5.10

  • Cast gethostname() arguments to a proper type.

0.5.9

  • Optimize getHostname for hostname command might not be installed.

0.5.8

  • Support get os-release information for Linux #38
Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

title: sort metadata corpus properties
body: This is used in the ANNIS frontend to change the displayed order of the metadata fields

title: Use correct layer when searching for segmentations with near operator
body: Fixes #238

title: Remove corpus storage directory lock file on exit.
body: Fixes #230

title: Document how to increase the process stack size in case a corpus needs it
body: Fixes #229

title: Make it easier to configure the web service for anyonmous corpus access
body:
Add setting `anonymous_access_all_corpora` to the auth web service configuration.

This allows to run a web service where all corpora are accessible to anonymous users, without configuration a keycloak or other auth service or configurating the sqlite database. This also fixes #234 .

title: Fix subgraph generation for segmentations with gaps
body:
Fix subgraph generation when a segmentation was defined as context and the
match includes a token that is not covered by a segmentation node (there are
gaps in the segmentation). This is achieved by explicitly searching for all
token between the first and last matched segment and produces a more complex
query than before. Because token where missing from the graph, it could appear
in ANNIS that there are gaps in the data and that the token order is
incorrect.

title: Fix timeout handling for queries with a lot of intermediate results, but less than 1000 matches.
body:
The timeout was only checked after each 1000th match. This
caused troubles for queries with complex temporary results that where
discarded. The query execution could take too long time and consume system
resources in a multi-user system even when the timeout was configured. The fix
is to push down the timeout check to the node search iterators.

The original implementation was made when the search iterators could not fail and return any errors.
So checking after each nth item was a compromise. For some offending queries like

```
edition & edition & text & #1_o_#3 & #2_o_#3 & #1.#2
```
on the DDD-AD 1.2 corpora, even checking each match would result in very long minimal execution time because of the work needed to find the first result. Since #219 the iterators can now return errors and we can create timeout errors in the most basic node search execution nodes.

title: Fix logic in non existing operator search when no value filter was given
Fix import of resolver mappings and order configuration for older rel…
body: …ANNIS versions.

title: Fix handling of Umlaut in corpus name in several places
body: Updated `delete` and various linked file related places to use the encoded corpus name as directory path.

title: Fix wrong web service version prefix
Fixed schema errors in the Webservice OpenAPI file
Trim resolver mapping entries (both the name and the value)
body: Fixes for compatibility issue #222

title: Improve and document CLI arguments for the query benchmark tool
Upgrade from deprecated windows-2016 to windows-2019
Refactored the basic `GraphStorage` and `AnnotationStorage` APIs to handle errors.
body:
Previously, we used mostly main memory containers which had an API
  that could not fail. This was reflected in the `GraphStorage` and
  `AnnotationStorage`  APIs, which directly returned the result or an iterator
  over the non-fallible results. With the addition of disk-based
  implementations, this API model was not possible to implement without using
  panics when repeated access to the disk failed. Some of the API that was
  changed was user visible when using the `graphannis-core` crate (and thus the
  C-API), so this release is not technically backwards-compatible. Adapting to
  the updated API should be restricted to handle the errors returned by the
  functions.

title: Use the transient-btree-index crate as C1 in DiskMap
Limit the number of disk maps for the GraphUpdate
body: This fixes issues with large corpora where the maximum number of open files per process might be reached.

title: Run cargo about to update third party license information
Fix memory leak in buffer when reading GraphML files
Use "rsplit_once" to split between node name and its path
Fix import of relANNIS 3.3 files with missing segmentation span
Improve speed of inserting items into GraphUpdate
Revert simplification with unknown performance implicitations
body: This reverts commit d198dce5f3d1e6a7d89567a7c97213de2e922761.

title: Fix relannis capacity overflow
Improve token search speed
Improve relANNIS import speed
Fix clippy issues
Limit memory consumption during relANNIS import
body:
- Limit the used main memory cache per `DiskTable` to about 100MB in the default configuration.
  Since we use a lot of disk-based maps during import of relANNIS files, this can add up to > 1GB easily.
  The maximum cache usage was much larger before, which amongst other issues caused #205 to happen.
  With this change, during relANNIS import the main memory usage should be limited to be less than 4GB, 
  which seams more reasonable than the previous 20+GB
- Reduce memory footprint during import when corpus contains a lot of escaped strings (as in #205)
- Avoid creating small fragmented main memory when importing corpora from relANNIS to help to fix #205

title: The webservice endpoint `/search/node-descriptions` now returns wether a node in the query is optional or not.
Fix crashes related to query re-ordering and optional nodes
body:
Queries with optional nodes with a smaller index than the last non-optional node could fail.
If the execution nodes re-order the match result vector internally, the query node index is
used to define the mapping. Unfortunately the largest index could be larger than the size of mappings,
which used to be used to create the output vector. By allowing empty elements in the output vector
and using the maximum value, we can still map the results properly.

title: Add test for non-bound nodes
Don't allow optional operands for non-negated operators
body: This might be supported in the future to allow e.g. for nodes to be not included in the result output, but the current behavior is neither tested or well-defined so disallow this scenario for now.

title: Implement negation for non-existing nodes
body:
This implements #187 but does not implement the more complex structures (as described in #199) yet. Also note that we changed form a prefix ? to a suffix, to make it easier to implement optional parts of the query term in the AQL parser later on when needed.

We implement these negated operators with non-existent operands as unary operators (with the existing node as the one that is filtered using the non-existent expression). There is also some refactoring and renaming to make it easier to use the value filter functions outside the conjunction code (in our operator) to avoid duplicated implementation of the node search logic.

title: Enforce static code analysis checks for pull requests.
body: This includes proper formatting and clippy warnings.

title: Use non-deprecated Ubuntu 18.04 when executing the tests
Fix all clippy warnings
Cache data directory for executing the search tests
body: This should speed up the tests. The downside, that only the search functionality and not the import is tested, has already been solved by a previous change. Also, the very slow RIDGES import has been deactivated already. This PR adapts the queries from the RIDGES corpus to other corpora.

title: Add tests for importing relANNIS files
body: This compares the import of a sample corpus via relANNIS with one performed by GraphML. This adds an explicit integration test for the relANNIS importer and allows to use a faster import mechanism for the indirect search tests (which primary should test the AQL execution).

title: Always compile cli and import relANNIS files.
body: Importing the relANNIS files is part of the tests. Otherwise the relANNIS import would be undertested

title: Update several dependencies
Improve CI execution time
Implement operator negation with existence assumption
body:
This implements #186 by splitting the current `BinaryOperator` trait into two traits (one that can only be used with nested loop joins and one that can be used with index joins) and adding an automatic implementation of the negated variant for each existing binary operator. This can only use the `filter_match` function, since there is no way to automatically find optimized implementations for the negation. A (slow) nested loop join is enforced instead. Since the current implementation of the negated operators are non-binding (as defined in #186), this is not  an issue since in most cases this will be an additional filter function and not be used to generate new right-hand-side matches for a given left-hand-side.

TO-DOs

- [x] Fix issues reported by clippy in the changed files
- [x] run benchmark to ensure no existing query is affected
- [x] add specific test queries for the new operator

title: Assume that the annis::node_name annotation is unique when estimating match size
Add 0 to default available context sizes.
body: This fixes #181 for corpora imported from relANNIS.

title: Ignore missing files directory when getting the linked files.
body:
We canonicalize the path to the files directory, but this assumes it exists.
An error was thrown when it did not, which is changed to an optional value in this PR.

title: Fix issues in C-API header
body: These issues are related to the Python API, which does some checks when parsing the header.

title: Add `export_to_fs` function to C-API
Synchronize REST API error output for bad AQL requests with the OpenAPI specification
